title: Auckland Shooting: 2 Killed in New Zealand as World Cup Is Set to Kick Off
description: There were also multiple injuries, the police said, and the gunman was also killed. The shooting was not far from where Norway’s national team is staying for the Women’s World Cup.

title: Russia Hits Grain Ports and Threatens Ships Headed to Ukraine
description: Ukraine accused Moscow of specifically targeting the infrastructure for exporting food, after Russia pulled out of an agreement allowing ships carrying grain to sail past its Black Sea blockade.

title: Morocco Invites Netanyahu to Visit, in a Possible Opening to Deeper Ties
description: The invitation came in a letter from King Mohammed VI to Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu of Israel thanking him for recognizing Moroccan sovereignty over Western Sahara.

title: U.S. to Send $1.3 Billion in Ukraine Aid, Bringing Total This Week to $2.3 Billion
description: The money is expected to be used to buy new air-defense missile systems and other military equipment.

title: Crimean authorities say a blast hit a military base, but Putin calls it a landfill.
What Russians saw on TV: The traitor and the ‘indisputable hero.’
description: Viewers of state media were told that a mutiny and other events are causes for celebration.

title: Video Appears to Show Wagner Leader Rallying Troops in Belarus
description: In the video, a man whose silhouette and voice closely resemble Mr. Prigozhin said that the Wagner fighters will stay in Belarus for some time to train its army.

title: Egypt Pardons Patrick Zaki and Mohamed el-Baqer
description: One of the presidential pardons came just a day after a graduate student was sentenced to three years for writing an article critical of the government.

title: Global Warming Is Bringing More Change Than Just Heat
description: Climate change is already affecting the world in powerful ways. But it could also drive mass migration and reshape societies as its consequences add up.

title: UK’s MI6 Chief Says Putin Cut a Deal to End Wagner Revolt
description: Richard Moore, the head of MI6, said the Russian leader acted “to save his skin,” offering rare insights into the events surrounding the sudden end of Yevgeny V. Prigozhin’s march on Moscow.

title: Heat Records Keep Falling: July Has Been a Scorcher
description: The first two weeks of July were very likely the warmest two-week period on record, scientists said.

title: Israeli President's Visit: Watch Live: Herzog Addresses Congress Amid Tensions Over Israel’s Policies
description: A handful of progressive Democrats boycotted the speech, a day after the House voted overwhelmingly in support of Israel — with some notable defections.

title: Why Odesa Is So Important to Ukraine in the War With Russia
description: Russia’s withdrawal from a U.N.-backed grain deal and its attacks on Odesa have brought the Black Sea port city’s importance back into focus.

title: Dermot Doran, Priest Who Rallied Aid for Biafran Airlift, Dies at 88
description: In 1968, Father Doran, who had been in Nigeria as an educator, became the linchpin of one of the largest civilian humanitarian efforts in history.

title: Can I Watch ‘Barbenheimer’ Despite the Hollywood Strikes?
description: People sympathetic with the actors’ and writers’ unions may be concerned, but they say it’s OK for now. And there’s no need to cancel your Netflix subscription either.

title: 1898: Riots in Shanghai Are Now Subsiding
description: Sailors remained on guard at the French settlement after violence in which 22 Chinese people were killed and 50 others wounded.

title: She’s on a Mission From God: Suing Big Oil for Climate Damages
description: A lawyer started small with a creative tactic. It grew into an effort that could force fossil fuel companies to pay hundreds of billions in damages.

title: Protests Simmer in Israel as Country’s President Prepares to Address Congress
description: The small protests reflect the broad nature of popular opposition to plans by Israel’s government to overhaul the judiciary, and seemed timed to coincide with the speech by President Isaac Herzog.

title: Russia-Ukraine War: Russia Targets Grain Sites in Odesa, Ukraine Says
description: Moscow launched drones and missiles in what Ukraine’s president said was a deliberate attack on facilities his country uses to export food.

title: Putin Will Not Attend BRICS Summit, South Africa’s President Says
description: The decision allows South Africa to avoid the predicament of whether to arrest the Russian leader, who is the subject of an international warrant, if he traveled to Johannesburg for a BRICS meeting.

title: North Korea Detains a U.S. Soldier: What to Know
description: The soldier, Pvt. Travis T. King, was supposed to be on a plane to the United States, but instead he joined a group tour of the DMZ. Then he bolted for the border.

title: Xi Rejects Pressure on China to Do More to Address Climate Change
description: The speech by China’s leader, Xi Jinping, to Chinese officials came as John Kerry, President Biden’s climate envoy, urged Beijing to move more quickly to address global warming.

title: How the World’s Two Largest Polluters, U.S. and China, Stack Up
description: From gas emissions to electric vehicles, here is how the world’s two biggest economies — and polluters — compare on taking steps to confront climate change.

title: Ghibli Park Celebrates “Totoro” And Other Miyazaki Movies
description: The Japanese company Studio Ghibli opened a theme park to celebrate the eccentric, charming animated movies of its founder, Hayao Miyazaki. Could two ‘Totoro’-loving toddlers find happiness there?

title: Read Your Way Through Salvador
description: The writer Itamar Vieira Junior says that to “feel the intensity of life on the streets of Salvador” in Bahia, Brazil, a reader must start with Jorge Amado.

title: Official Data Hinted at China’s Hidden Covid Toll. Then it Vanished.
description: Epidemiologists say a rise in cremations in an eastern province was the latest indication that the country’s official death toll from Covid is a vast undercount.

title: The grain deal helped make food more affordable to poor nations.
U.K. Inflation Rate Slows to 7.9 Percent
description: The larger-than-expected slowdown, led by motor vehicle fuel prices, offers some relief to the government and the Bank of England.

title: Thai PM Vote: Move Forward Coalition With Pheu Thai at Risk
description: After failing to choose a prime minister, Parliament will vote again as protesters gather outside. The process is a test for democracy in a nation with a history of coups.

title: Your Wednesday Briefing
description: Extreme heat across the world.

title: Spain, Facing a Future of Drought, Turns to Medieval Solutions
description: Acequias, a network of water channels created by the Moors over 1,000 years ago, are being excavated and brought back to life to adapt to the crises of climate change.

title: Ukrainian Soldiers Fight to Reclaim Their Own Towns From Russia
description: Ukraine lets soldiers from towns occupied by the Russian military join the battle to reclaim them.

title: As Sunak Makes His Case to Britons, the Economy Undermines It
description: Britain’s stubbornly high inflation rate has come to symbolize a deeper economic malaise — a morass of problems, some new, others longstanding, that are stymying Prime Minister Rishi Sunak.

title: Kissinger Makes Surprise Visit to China, Meets Defense Minister
description: Henry Kissinger met with China’s defense minister, who last month had rejected an invitation to meet with the current American defense minister.
